column4: if i untar a package, then "./configure" then "make" then "makeinstall", i can then remove the package i untarred?
depends, some have a "make uninstall" command, some don't
you can try running "make uninstall" from where you ran "make install" and see, if it doesn't work you need to manually find and delete the files
you can use checkinstall to make a deb from the make install command, then you can ensure you can remove it later if you want
